page.title: 04** MR.LEWIS REMEMBERS **
page.content: Mr.Lewis one of the fathers of children in the school has lived in Wiston all his life. He is a Church Warden and a Governor of our school. He came into school so that we could talk to him and ask him questions about Wiston. The first thing we wanted to know was how Wiston has changed during his life time. He remembered the old primary school in Wiston closing about 15 years ago. The old buildings are at the bottom of the drive to our new school. When the old school closed there were about 20 children and 2 teachers,and they transferred to Llawhaden School.All the pupils were able to walk to school in those days,there was much less traffic. There was no school field so the Sports were held in the road outside the school!
